t: Matthew 25
The Parable of the Ten Virgins
“Then*rp the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r will*r be*r like*r ten*r virgins*r who*r took*r their*r lamps*r and*r went*r to*r meet*r the*r bridegroom.*r
Five*r of*r them*r were*r foolish,*r and*r five*r were*r wise.*r
For*r when*r the*r foolish*r took*r their*r lamps,*r they*r took*r no*r oil*r with*r them,*r
but*r the*r wise*r took*r flasks*r of*r oil*r with*r their*r lamps.*r
As*r the*r bridegroom*r was*r delayed,*r they*r all*r became*r drowsy*r and*r slept.*r
But*r at*r midnight*r there*r was*r a*r cry,*r ‘Here*r is*r the*r bridegroom!*r Come*r out*r to*r meet*r him.’*r
Then*r all*r those*r virgins*r rose*r and*r trimmed*r their*r lamps.*r
And*r the*r foolish*r said*r to*r the*r wise,*r ‘Give*r us*r some*r of*r your*r oil,*r for*r our*r lamps*r are*r going*r out.’*r
But*r the*r wise*r answered,*r saying,*r ‘Since*r there*r will*r not*r be*r enough*r for*r us*r and*r for*r you,*r go*r rather*r to*r the*r dealers*r and*r buy*r for*r yourselves.’*r
And*r while*r they*r were*r going*r to*r buy,*r the*r bridegroom*r came,*r and*r those*r who*r were*r ready*r went*r in*r with*r him*r to*r the*r marriage*r feast,*r and*r the*r door*r was*r shut.*r
Afterward*r the*r other*r virgins*r came*r also,*r saying,*r ‘Lord,*r lord,*r open*r to*r us.’*r
But*r he*r answered,*r ‘Truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r do*r not*r know*r you.’*r
Watch*r therefore,*r for*r you*r know*r neither*r the*r day*r nor*r the*r hour.*r
The Parable of the Talents
“For*rp it*r will*r be*r like*r a*r man*r going*r on*r a*r journey,*r who*r called*r his*r servants*r and*r entrusted*r to*r them*r his*r property.*r
To*r one*r he*r gave*r five*r talents,*r to*r another*r two,*r to*r another*r one,*r to*r each*r according*r to*r his*r ability.*r Then*r he*r went*r away.*r
He*r who*r had*r received*r the*r five*r talents*r went*r at*r once*r and*r traded*r with*r them,*r and*r he*r made*r five*r talents*r more.*r
So*r also*r he*r who*r had*r the*r two*r talents*r made*r two*r talents*r more.*r
But*r he*r who*r had*r received*r the*r one*r talent*r went*r and*r dug*r in*r the*r ground*r and*r hid*r his*r master’s*r money.*r
Now*r after*r a*r long*r time*r the*r master*r of*r those*r servants*r came*r and*r settled*r accounts*r with*r them.*r

And*r he*r who*r had*r received*r the*r five*r talents*r came*r forward,*r bringing*r five*r talents*r more,*r saying,*r ‘Master,*r you*r delivered*r to*r me*r five*r talents;*r here,*r I*r have*r made*r five*r talents*r more.’*r

His*r master*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Well*r done,*r good*r and*r faithful*r servant.*r You*r have*r been*r faithful*r over*r a*r little;*r I*r will*r set*r you*r over*r much.*r Enter*r into*r the*r joy*r of*r your*r master.’*r
And*r he*r also*r who*r had*r the*r two*r talents*r came*r forward,*r saying,*r ‘Master,*r you*r delivered*r to*r me*r two*r talents;*r here,*r I*r have*r made*r two*r talents*r more.’*r

His*r master*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Well*r done,*r good*r and*r faithful*r servant.*r You*r have*r been*r faithful*r over*r a*r little;*r I*r will*r set*r you*r over*r much.*r Enter*r into*r the*r joy*r of*r your*r master.’*r

He*r also*r who*r had*r received*r the*r one*r talent*r came*r forward,*r saying,*r ‘Master,*r I*r knew*r you*r to*r be*r a*r hard*r man,*r reaping*r where*r you*r did*r not*r sow,*r and*r gathering*r where*r you*r scattered*r no*r seed,*r
so*r I*r was*r afraid,*r and*r I*r went*r and*r hid*r your*r talent*r in*r the*r ground.*r Here,*r you*r have*r what*r is*r yours.’*r
But*r his*r master*r answered*r him,*r ‘You*r wicked*r and*r slothful*r servant!*r You*r knew*r that*r I*r reap*r where*r I*r have*r not*r sown*r and*r gather*r where*r I*r scattered*r no*r seed?*r
Then*r you*r ought*r to*r have*r invested*r my*r money*r with*r the*r bankers,*r and*r at*r my*r coming*r I*r should*r have*r received*r what*r was*r my*r own*r with*r interest.*r
So*r take*r the*r talent*r from*r him*r and*r give*r it*r to*r him*r who*r has*r the*r ten*r talents.*r

For*r to*r everyone*r who*r has*r will*r more*r be*r given,*r and*r he*r will*r have*r an*r abundance.*r But*r from*r the*r one*r who*r has*r not,*r even*r what*r he*r has*r will*r be*r taken*r away.*r
And*r cast*r the*r worthless*r servant*r into*r the*r outer*r darkness.*r In*r that*r place*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.’*r
The Final Judgment
“When*rp the*r Son*r of*r Man*r comes*r in*r his*r glory,*r and*r all*r the*r angels*r with*r him,*r then*r he*r will*r sit*r on*r his*r glorious*r throne.*r
Before*r him*r will*r be*r gathered*r all*r the*r nations,*r and*r he*r will*r separate*r people*r one*r from*r another*r as*r a*r shepherd*r separates*r the*r sheep*r from*r the*r goats.*r
And*r he*r will*r place*r the*r sheep*r on*r his*r right,*r but*r the*r goats*r on*r the*r left.*r

Then*r the*r King*r will*r say*r to*r those*r on*r his*r right,*r ‘Come,*r you*r who*r are*r blessed*r by*r my*r Father,*r inherit*r the*r kingdom*r prepared*r for*r you*r from*r the*r foundation*r of*r the*r world.*r
For*r I*r was*r hungry*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r food,*r I*r was*r thirsty*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r drink,*r I*r was*r a*r stranger*r and*r you*r welcomed*r me,*r
I*r was*r naked*r and*r you*r clothed*r me,*r I*r was*r sick*r and*r you*r visited*r me,*r I*r was*r in*r prison*r and*r you*r came*r to*r me.’*r
Then*r the*r righteous*r will*r answer*r him,*r saying,*r ‘Lord,*r when*r did*r we*r see*r you*r hungry*r and*r feed*r you,*r or*r thirsty*r and*r give*r you*r drink?*r
And*r when*r did*r we*r see*r you*r a*r stranger*r and*r welcome*r you,*r or*r naked*r and*r clothe*r you?*r
And*r when*r did*r we*r see*r you*r sick*r or*r in*r prison*r and*r visit*r you?’*r
And*r the*r King*r will*r answer*r them,*r ‘Truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r as*r you*r did*r it*r to*r one*r of*r the*r least*r of*r these*r my*r brothers,*r you*r did*r it*r to*r me.’*r
“Then*rp he*r will*r say*r to*r those*r on*r his*r left,*r ‘Depart*r from*r me,*r you*r cursed,*r into*r the*r eternal*r fire*r prepared*r for*r the*r devil*r and*r his*r angels.*r
For*r I*r was*r hungry*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r no*r food,*r I*r was*r thirsty*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r no*r drink,*r
I*r was*r a*r stranger*r and*r you*r did*r not*r welcome*r me,*r naked*r and*r you*r did*r not*r clothe*r me,*r sick*r and*r in*r prison*r and*r you*r did*r not*r visit*r me.’*r

Then*r they*r also*r will*r answer,*r saying,*r ‘Lord,*r when*r did*r we*r see*r you*r hungry*r or*r thirsty*r or*r a*r stranger*r or*r naked*r or*r sick*r or*r in*r prison,*r and*r did*r not*r minister*r to*r you?’*r
Then*r he*r will*r answer*r them,*r saying,*r ‘Truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r as*r you*r did*r not*r do*r it*r to*r one*r of*r the*r least*r of*r these,*r you*r did*r not*r do*r it*r to*r me.’*r
And*r these*r will*r go*r away*r into*r eternal*r punishment,*r but*r the*r righteous*r into*r eternal*r life.”*r
